meanings.definition: A unit of measurement for osmotic pressure
meanings.sent1: The doctor measured the milliosmol of the solution to understand its effect on cells.
meanings.sent2: The lab report showed a high milliosmol level in the blood sample.
meanings.sent3: The competition for the highest milliosmol reading in the experiment was intense.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was a milliosmol of strength in the face of adversity.
meanings.sent5: The concept of milliosmol became clearer after the science class demonstration.

meanings.sent1: The tiny organism could only survive in a milliosmol concentration of the solution.
meanings.sent2: The scientist calculated the exact milliosmol value needed for the experiment.
meanings.sent3: The milliosmol measurement was so small, it felt like finding a needle in a haystack.
meanings.sent4: In the vast ocean of data, his contribution was just a milliosmol of information.
meanings.sent5: The milliosmol measurement was crucial for the success of the research project.
